page.title: 10A Visit to an Old House.
page.content: One of the oldest buildings in Endon is Sutton House.Like many other properties it has been altered and added to by successive generations.The original structure is early sixteenth century.Embedded in this part are the remains of an early timber frame"cruck" roof".The frame is made of oak and there are remains of wattle and daub in the boundary wall between the timber frame section and a later stone built extension.There is a large inglenook fireplace and several mullioned windows.It is also heavily beamed and contains a fine Tudor hearth.In the mid eighteenth century a completely new north wing was added with a Classical style doorway and sash windows.The house is named after the Sutton Family, who were associated with Endon from the sixteenth to the eighteenth centuries. It is a "listed" building.
